titleStmt.title: Istanbul, Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi), E. H. 35 [= Karatay 38]

msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 7 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 35; Text: Q 27:4-15, Q 38:28-73; 6 lines per page; Dimensions: 215 x 140 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, pp. 14-15: "38 E. H. 35 Kur’an’dan parçalar Parşömen. 140mm boy ve 215mm eninde cönk şeklinde 7 yaprak. Sahifede II-III. (VIII-IX) asır kûfîsi ile 160mm uzunl.[uğunda] 6 satır. Vişneçürüğü deri Osmanlı cildi. Bu cilt gayet karışık olarak dikilmiştir; Y. 1a Ṣād (38) suresinin 28. ayetinin sonunda (كا)لمفسدين في الارض ام نجعل المتقين كالفجار ile başlamakta ve 31. ayetle bitmektedir; Y. 2a Naml (27) suresinin 4. ayetinin ortasından 7. ayetin ortasına; Y. 3-Ṣād (38) suresinin 68. ayetinin son kelimesinden aynı surenin 73. ayetinin son kelimesine; Y. 4 ve 5 Naml (27) suresinin son kelimesinden 12. ayetin sonlarına doğru; Y. 6a Ṣād (38) in 51. ayetinin son kelimesinden 58. ayetin sonuna; Y. 7a Naml (27) in 12. ayetinin yarısından 15. ayetin ولقد آتينا داوود وسليمان علما cümlesine kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "38 E. H. 35 Fragments of the Qurʾān Parchment. 7 junk shaped leaves of 140 mm height and 215 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 2nd-3rd (8th-9th) centuries [contains] 6 lines measuring 160 mm. Cherry brown colored leather Ottoman binding. This fragment is sewn quite mixed. L. 1a begins with the words (كا)لمفسدين في الارض ام نجعل المتقين كالفجار of the end of Q 38:28 (Sūra Ṣād) and ends with verse 31. L. 2a begins in the middle of Q 27:4 (Sūra al-Naml) and [continues until] the middle part of verse 7. L. 3 is from the last word of Q 38:68 (Sūra Ṣād) to the last word of verse 73 of the same sūra. L. 4 and 5 are from the last word of Q 27 (Sūra al-Naml) until the end of verse 12. L. 6a is from the last word of Q 38:51(Sūra Ṣād) until the end of verse 58. L. 7a starts halfway through the verse Q 27:12 (Sūra al-Naml) and continues until the words ولقد آتينا داوود وسليمان علما of verse 15."
